amendatorysection.para: It is the duty of the clerk of each of the courts to file together and carefully preserve in his office all papers delivered to him for that purpose in every action or special proceeding.

annotation.para: Papers are filed in office of clerk of district court only when deposited with the proper officer in his office and received by him in his official capacity. Jolliffe v. City of North Platte, 139 Neb. 431, 297 N.W. 666 (1941).
This section requires the clerk of the trial court to file all documents delivered to him or her for that purpose. State v. Muse, 15 Neb. App. 13, 721 N.W.2d 661 (2006).
